Append rows to a tsibble

append-row.Rd

Add new rows to the end of a tsibble by filling a key-index pair and NA for measured variables.

append_row(.data, n = 1L, ...)

Arguments

.data

A tbl_ts.
n

An integer indicates the number of key-index pair to append.
...

Passed to individual S3 method.

Details

append_case() is an alias of append_row().

See also

new_data for generating new observations to a tsibble

Examples

tsbl <- tsibble(
  date = rep(as.Date("2017-01-01") + 0:2, each = 2),
  group = rep(letters[1:2], 3),
  value = rnorm(6),
  key = id(group)
)
#> Column `date` is the index.
append_row(tsbl)
#> # A tsibble: 8 x 3 [1D]
#> # Key:       group [2]
#>   date       group     value
#>   <date>     <chr>     <dbl>
#> 1 2017-01-01 a      -1.40   
#> 2 2017-01-02 a      -2.44   
#> 3 2017-01-03 a       0.622  
#> 4 2017-01-04 a      NA      
#> 5 2017-01-01 b       0.255  
#> 6 2017-01-02 b      -0.00557
#> 7 2017-01-03 b       1.15   
#> 8 2017-01-04 b      NA      
append_row(tsbl, n = 2)
#> # A tsibble: 10 x 3 [1D]
#> # Key:       group [2]
#>    date       group     value
#>    <date>     <chr>     <dbl>
#>  1 2017-01-01 a      -1.40   
#>  2 2017-01-02 a      -2.44   
#>  3 2017-01-03 a       0.622  
#>  4 2017-01-04 a      NA      
#>  5 2017-01-05 a      NA      
#>  6 2017-01-01 b       0.255  
#>  7 2017-01-02 b      -0.00557
#>  8 2017-01-03 b       1.15   
#>  9 2017-01-04 b      NA      
#> 10 2017-01-05 b      NA
